required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Assessment of Spot Reduction in Adults Males Following Endurance Training

collaborator.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: Spot reduction, referring to local body fat reduction, pertains to subcutaneous adipose tissue utilization from specific body parts during exercise. Its existence has been keenly debated, although generally accepted not to occur during exercise. However, it is based on not only equivocal data - commonly the training protocol typically applied is based on strength rather than endurance training. The investigators sought to test this assumption by utilizing endurance based exercise controlling for energy expenditure and using dual x-ray absorptiometric measures to assess body composition before and after training.

study_design_info.masking_description: Assessor of dual x-ray absorptiometry results was blinded to group allocation

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Fat mass located in trunk (g) measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Fat mass located in lower extremities (g) measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Fat mass located in upper extremities (g) measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Total fat mass (g) measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
other_outcome.description: Lean mass located in trunk (g) measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
other_outcome.description: Lean mass located in lower extremities (g) measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
other_outcome.description: Lean mass located in upper extremities (g) measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
other_outcome.description: Total lean mass (g) measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
other_outcome.description: Maximal oxygen uptake by cardiopulmonary indirect calorimetry

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre (baseline) to post test (after 10 weeks)
other_outcome.description: One-repetition maximum (kg) in torso rotation and abdominal crunch

arm_group.description: Subjects were combining treadmill running at 70% HRmax (27 minutes) with 4x4minutes (30-40% maximal strength, 1RM) of torso rotation and abdominal crunches (57 minutes), 4 d per wk for 10 weeks
Subjects performed only treadmill running (45 minutes) at 70% HRmax for 4 d per week for 10 weeks.

intervention.description: Subjects combined treadmill running at 70% HRmax (27 minutes) with 4x4minutes (30-40% maximal strength, 1RM) of torso rotation and abdominal crunches (57 minutes), 4 days per wk for 10 weeks
Subjects performed treadmill running (45 minutes) at 70% HRmax 4 days per week for 10 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- males
- ≥ 30 years old
- classified as overweight (Body mass index ≥ 25 kg ∙ m-2)
- not participating in regular physical training
Exclusion Criteria:
- < 30 years old
- Body mass index < 25 kg ∙ m-2
- participating in regular physical training
